response:
Urgent MRI is needed to confirm the left midbrain lesion, characterise its nature (demyelinating vs vascular vs neoplastic) and assess the optic nerve. CSF and serological studies help distinguish multiple sclerosis from NMO/MOG and other inflammatory or infectious causes. Vascular imaging evaluates for stroke or aneurysm. Ancillary tests document visual pathway damage and screen for systemic disease and treatment contraindications.
